brewery.brewery_description: We are proud custodians of a Victorian brewery in Scotland's capital.  The Caledonian Brewery was built in 1869, drawing on abundant supplies of local barley and mineral-rich well water.  The brew house, blessed with Victorian ingenuity, is still right at the heart of our brewing process.  Our direct-fired open coppers are believed to be the last remaining in Europe of this size and age in commercial use.  With nearly a century and a half of brewing experience, we are continuously trying out new ideas to make sure that our beers remain as relevant for the tastes of today's drinkers as they were for generations before.

beer.beer_description:
Appearance – Polished bronze ale. 
Aroma – Piny, soft fruit citrus aromas of tangerine and grapefruit with a hint of spice. 
Flavours – Hoppy, with luscious lime, passion fruit and some kiwi fruit notes. 
Finish – Smooth, rounded bitterness but with a tantalising zesty finish.

items.badge_description: Unlike The Highlander from TV, there are more than just one brewery in Scotland fighting the great craft beer war. Join the battle. No kilt required. Try 5 more for Level 4.

items.badge_description: Want to enjoy a day of brews, but need to keep your wits sharp? There are plenty of delicious brews under 5% for you to sip on throughout the day. That's 335 different beers with an ABV of 5% and lower.

Round and round the wheel goes! Which style you’ll be drinking, nobody knows! Your desire to explore different styles is inspiring. Keep it up! That's a check-in to at least 60 different styles. Try 5 more for Level 13!
Your quest to quench your thirst leaves no stone unturned! That's at least 115 distinct venues!
Traveling the world is hard, but not for you. It's as easy as cracking open a new brew! You have had a beer from at least 25 different regions around the world. Try 5 more for Level 6!
After a long day, what better way to kick back than with a crisp and refreshing lager? You're already feeling more relaxed, aren’t you?. That’s 285 different Lagers! Try 5 more for Level 58!

You don’t have to be a superhero to enjoy a strong beer. Boasting a higher than average ABV, these styles really do pack a punch, so be ready for it. That's 80 different beers with style of Strong Ale - American, Strong Ale - English, Strong Ale - Other, Belgian Strong Dark Ale, Belgian Strong Golden Ale or Lager - Strong. Try 5 more for Level 17!

items.checkin_comment: The smoothest ipa I've had, mild malty flavour. Going down easily.

beer.beer_description:
A naturally brilliant blend of malt and hop characters. Solid gold colour, remarkably aromatic. smooth body with hints of fresh citrus. Dry delicate hop flower finish. A drink that is both distinctive and long on refreshment.
3.8% abv in cask and 4.4% in .

beer.beer_description: What better way to toast the fall than to have a bottle of this formidable, dual character brew. At first smooth with mellow overtones of sweet berry fruit, a bite of bitterness suddenly cuts through, long, deep and lingering. Brewed with Rye Malt, it is naturally "blood red" in colour. Unlike the mythical wolf-like creature said to roam the bleak moorland surrounding Newcastle, this is real, so consider yourself warned!

A naturally brilliant blend of malt and hop characters. Solid gold colour, remarkably aromatic. smooth body with hints of fresh citrus. Dry delicate hop flower finish. A drink that is both distinctive and long on refreshment.
3.8% abv in cask and 4.4% in .

Appearance – Polished bronze ale. 
Aroma – Piny, soft fruit citrus aromas of tangerine and grapefruit with a hint of spice. 
Flavours – Hoppy, with luscious lime, passion fruit and some kiwi fruit notes. 
Finish – Smooth, rounded bitterness but with a tantalising zesty finish.

An Englishman’s first love is his brown ale. However, in the summer he often fancies blondes instead! With this inspiration, we’ve created Newcastle Bombshell, an English style blonde ale. The combination of Cascade, Hellertau and Northdown hops balance this golden coloured ale’s light aroma and bitterness with toasted malt to ensure a silky smooth finish. After one sip of this brew, we’re sure you’ll agree she’s a real bombshell.

There are many way to order a Newcastle Cabbie, but we chose ‘hail’ because it sounds like a cabbie word. Newcastle Cabbie is brewed with dark malts and noble hop aroma to create a flavour with hints of chocolate, coffee and light fruit – because we think those words will make your mouth water. So if all those words don’t make you want to grab a Cabbie, the label guy obviously lied to us.

Scotch Ale is a classic brew that originated in Edinburgh, Scotland in the 18th century. Rich, full-flavoured and fulfilling, our Scoth Ale is a blend of malts with toffee notes and a mellow hop. The beauty of this style is its fulsome malt character that is simply mouth-watering.

We bring you Newcastle Founder’s Ale, a unique Limited Edition brew with the drinkability you expect from Newcastle.

Our Newcastle founders came together to produce beers with real star quality. This ale is a tribute to the heritage and authenticity of those top brewers of Victorian Newcastle.

Founders’ is a pale ale with a dry hoppy flavour and aroma. It is sweet rather than bitter with a clean short finish.

What better way to toast the season of renewal.

Brewed with flavorful hops and seductive malt, our Newcastle Winter IPA hearkens back to the original India Pale Ale recipes of the 1700s. A balanced body, warm mouth-feel, and long, bittersweet finish make it the perfect beer for the season. It's zesty yet subtle, strong yet creamy. If only winter could last just a wee bit longer.

Pale Ales date back to the 18th century in England. They were lighter in colour than other beers of the time and commonly referred to as 'Bitters'. The Caledonian Brewery has mastered the art of brewing bitters since 1869. 

This brew continues the tradition with a golden amber colour, sweet citric hop aroma, classic British woody spice and rounded herbal bitterness.

The Caledonian Brewery has been at the heart of Edinburgh life for over 145 years. We brew our beers with passion and pride, in a traditional Victorian brewery, set in the heart of Edinburgh. 
We’re delighted to have signed an agreement with Historic Scotland to use the world-famous landmark and the name ‘Edinburgh Castle’ which reflects the pride we have in our Edinburgh roots.

Newcastle Summer  is a small-batch brew specially concocted at the legendary Caledonian Brewery – a 140 year-old Scottish landmark that still features open-fired coppers.

Don’t let its light, golden-yellow color fool you. Our Summer Ale packs a secret punch that’s just as bold as it is refreshing. It’s crisp with a touch of caramel, medium sweet in the middle, with a deliciously dry, hoppy finish that’s just the thing for a warm summer’s day. Or any time you’re feeling summery, really.

IPA’s are a highly hopped style of Pale Ale that originated in England in the early 19th century wo withstand transport to British troops serving in India.

To this day, the Caledonian brewery continues to use vintage 1869 open flamed copper kettles to brew their beers.

This session IPA is deep golden in colour with floral grapefruit hop aroma and lemon zesty bitterness to finish.

Full-flavoured ruby beer combing the best of Scottish barley and English hops, profoundly malty in aroma and flavours but balanced with a raisiny spiciness and toasty dryness. Distinctive fresh, slightly citrus tang with a rich finish.

Exceptional in Summer, Irresistible All Year Round. Enticing floral aromas from Cascade hops while Hersbrucker add more floral and soft fruit, Northdown hops develop aromas and light bitterness, all balanced by a malty moreish flavour and satisfying bitterness. Malted wheat ensures a silky smooth finish.

The addition of extra hops to this masterful IPA ensures it will withstand the rigours of the Atlantic Ocean and come to you in pristine quality. Dark gold with malty undertones, floral/citrus notes and aroma with bold bitterness balanced by a sweet finish. A legendary brew to be equally enjoyed by local Brits and those abroad.

Autumn has often been associated with melancholy. The possibilities of summer are gone and the chill of winter is on the horizon. Keats was more optimistic in the season of mists and mellow fruitfulness. We think likewise, although it may be wise to spend more time under cover with this comforting and rewarding red ale and remember after the gold of summer, comes the red of autumn.

Spring is in the air and what better way to herald the new season with some fresh spring zest. Spring is in the air and what better way to herald the new season with some fresh spring zest. For this we are using hops famed for their zesty citric and piny qualities, to deliver flavours of grapefruit and orange.

The tournament favourite, our regular rugby recipe returns. This is the one that you can depend on, to embrace the adulation of victory and deflect the depths of despair in defeat. The recipe of success is down to experience, great preparation and creativity. Seek those attributes in this perfect selection for match day.

This style is the highest gravity offering in the bitters family, which originating as the draft range of English pale ales. Strong bitters work well as a choice for the winter warmer. Richly flavoured with bold malt and hop bitterness, medium bodied with a fruity estery character. Idea for those chilling winter evenings standing at the log fire of your local.

HISTORY® has partnered with Newcastle to create a unique, custom draught beer to commemorate the third season of the acclaimed scripted series VIKINGS.

Newcastle VIKINGS Amber Ale is an amber beer that owes its colour to a full blend of roasted malts providing full bodied flavour, curbed by a slight, pleasant bitterness from aromatic German Hallertau Magnum hops.

Newcastle VIKINGS Amber Ale is brewed at Heineken’s Koninklijke Brand Bierbrouwerij, the oldest brewery in the Netherlands, founded in 1340. The brewery is in the southern-most part of the country, a region where actual Vikings are said to have roamed between 800 and 900 A.D.
Black beer with citric floral & herbal aroma bittersweet dark malt & citric hop

Port of Leith Scottish IPA (ABV 5%) combines Super Styrian, Summit and Amarillo hops to create a copper ale with a strong hop aroma, caramel and malt flavours and a bold malt & bitter hop finish. It’s a great match for strong cheeses and spicy food, especially, as you might imagine, a classic Indian curry.
Dark brown full-bodied ale, with subtle combination of smoky flavours nut, biscuit and chocolate. Supernaturally smooth indulgence! Seasonal.
